results.title: The First motion picture show
results.brief_description: Excellent combination of artwork, old still photos, and animation illustrates the successive stages leading to the first successful public motion-picture demonstration in 1880. Traces the technological development of the three essential components of the motion picture: projection, animation and photography.
results.description: Excellent combination of artwork, old still photos, and animation illustrates the successive stages leading to the first successful public motion-picture demonstration in 1880. results.title: The First mile up
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film on air pollution, with surprising disclosures of what the seemingly empty air around us holds. The film noses around the atmosphere that encloses our Earth - the comparatively thin envelope of air on which all life depends. The problem is discussed by engineers, health authorities and scientists, including Nobel-prize-winning chemist Dr. Linus Pauling.

results.title: First men into space
results.brief_description: This film is concerned with solving space survival problems. It recreates, with live photography, animation and scale models, the first American orbital space flight, and illustrates some problems of man’s survival in the hostile environment.

results.title: Emotions of every day living. No. 6. First lessons
results.creator_credit: Frank Beckwith, Howard A. Lesser, Knickerbocker Productions and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: A teacher is faced with many problems when an aggressive child becomes a member of her second grade class. The disrupting influence of the new boy, whose emotional difficulties lead him to bully the other children, is skilfully dealt with by the understanding teacher who not only helps the boy, but restores balance in the classroom by helping the other children handle their feelings. A problem in group dynamics is solved by adjustment which gives the children insight into the feelings that lie behind their actions.

results.title: The First five minutes
results.brief_description: Illustrates the fact that the first five minutes are the most important in fighting fires. Shows the best methods to be used in preventing and extinguishing fires by brigades organised in industries as well as municipal brigades.

results.title: The First fifty years: Kenya and Tanganyika
results.creator_credit: Sylvia Story and Mercury Film Productions
results.brief_description: The development of the grain milling industry in Kenya and Tanganyika. The major part of the film deals with the work of UNGA, a large scale wheat growing and marketing organisation in Kenya, with other sequences giving a general picture of progress in the agricultural industry, underlining the contribution of modern plant, qualified technicians, research and advisory services.

results.title: The First animated step
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Early history of primitive film technology coupled with an explanation and examples of different types of animation. This documentary also shows how animation is achieved by both professionals and amateurs. A film for students and teachers.

results.title: First aid on the spot
results.brief_description: Six common types of injuries and disabilities and the American Red Cross technique for treating each, with demonstrations of caring for wounds, burns and schock; of controlling bleeding; splinting a fracture; and administering artificial respiraiton by both approved methods.

results.title: First aid on the dairy farm
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Cineservice and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Cases in which the farmer can be of immediate aid to his animals, before calling the veterinarian. The film deals with milk fever, pink eye, mastitis, teat injuries, administration of medicine, bloat, choke, prussic acid poisoning, wounds, first aid kit.

results.title: First aid: fundamentals
results.brief_description: Defines first aid as the first emergency help given to an injured or sick person to help ease pain and prevent further injury. Explains how to treat skin wounds, minor burns, rashes, sprained ankles, and bruises; how to administer artificial respiration; and how to stop bleeding and prevent infection and shock.
